com.jjoe64.graphview

Class Viewport

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jjoe64.graphview.Viewport

  • public class Viewport
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the default implementation for the viewport. This implementation so for a normal viewport where there is a horizontal x-axis and a vertical y-axis. This viewport is compatible with - BarGraphSeries - LineGraphSeries - PointsGraphSeries

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Viewport.AxisBoundsStatus
      the state of the axis bounds
      static interface  Viewport.OnXAxisBoundsChangedListener
      listener to notify when x bounds changed after scaling or scrolling.

      void calcCompleteRange()
      caches the complete range (minX, maxX, minY, maxY) by iterating all series and all datapoints and stores it into #mCompleteRange for the x-range it will respect the series on the second scale - not for y-values

      • mMinimalViewport

        private RectD mMinimalViewport
        minimal viewport used for scaling and scrolling. this is used if the data that is available is less then the viewport that we want to be able to display. Double.NaN to disable this value

      • mOnXAxisBoundsChangedListener

        protected Viewport.OnXAxisBoundsChangedListener mOnXAxisBoundsChangedListener
        listener to notify when x bounds changed after scaling or scrolling. This can be used to load more detailed data.

      • mYAxisBoundsStatus

        protected Viewport.AxisBoundsStatus mYAxisBoundsStatus
        state of the y axis

      • referenceX

        protected double referenceX
        this reference value is used to generate the horizontal labels. It is used when the x axis bounds is set manual and humanRounding=false. it will be the minValueX value.

      • referenceY

        protected double referenceY
        this reference value is used to generate the vertical labels. It is used when the y axis bounds is set manual and humanRounding=false. it will be the minValueY value.

      • scalableY

        protected boolean scalableY
        flag whether the vertical scaling is activated

      • scrollableY

        private boolean scrollableY
        flag whether the viewport is scalable on the Y axis

    • Method Detail

      • calcCompleteRange

        public void calcCompleteRange()
        caches the complete range (minX, maxX, minY, maxY) by iterating all series and all datapoints and stores it into #mCompleteRange for the x-range it will respect the series on the second scale - not for y-values

      • computeScroll

        public void computeScroll()
        not used currently

        draws the glowing edge effect
        Parameters:

      • drawEdgeEffectsUnclipped

        private void drawEdgeEffectsUnclipped(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Draws the overscroll "glow" at the four edges of the chart region, if necessary.
        See Also:
        EdgeEffectCompat

      • drawFirst

        public void drawFirst(android.graphics.Canvas c)
        will be first called in order to draw the canvas Used to draw the background
        Parameters:
        c - canvas.

        private void fling(int velocityX,
                   int velocityY)
        not used currently
        Parameters:

        velocityY -

        public int getBackgroundColor()
        Returns:
        background of the viewport area

      • getBorderColor

        public int getBorderColor()
        the border color used. will be ignored when a custom paint is set.
        Returns:
        border color. by default the grid color is used
        See Also:
        setDrawBorder(boolean)

      • getMaxX

        public double getMaxX(boolean completeRange)
        Parameters:
        completeRange - if true => maxX of the complete range of all series if false => maxX of the current visible viewport
        Returns:
        the max x value

      • getMaxXAxisSize

        public double getMaxXAxisSize()
        maximum allowed viewport size (horizontal) 0 means use the bounds of the actual data that is available

      • getMaxY

        public double getMaxY(boolean completeRange)
        Parameters:
        completeRange - if true => maxY of the complete range of all series if false => maxY of the current visible viewport
        Returns:
        the max y value

      • getMaxYAxisSize

        public double getMaxYAxisSize()
        maximum allowed viewport size (vertical) 0 means use the bounds of the actual data that is available

        public double getMinX(boolean completeRange)
        Parameters:
        completeRange - if true => minX of the complete range of all series if false => minX of the current visible viewport
        Returns:
        the min x value

      • getMinY

        public double getMinY(boolean completeRange)
        Parameters:
        completeRange - if true => minY of the complete range of all series if false => minY of the current visible viewport
        Returns:
        the min y value

      • getOnXAxisBoundsChangedListener

        public Viewport.OnXAxisBoundsChangedListener getOnXAxisBoundsChangedListener()
        Returns:
        the listener when there is one registered.

      • getReferenceX

        protected double getReferenceX()
        the reference number to generate the labels
        Returns:
        by default 0, only when manual bounds and no human rounding is active, the min x value is returned

      • getReferenceY

        protected double getReferenceY()
        the reference number to generate the labels
        Returns:
        by default 0, only when manual bounds and no human rounding is active, the min y value is returned

      • getXAxisBoundsStatus

        public Viewport.AxisBoundsStatus getXAxisBoundsStatus()
        Returns:
        the x axis state

        Returns:
        the y axis state

        whether the viewport is scalable

        whether the viewport is scrollable

        public boolean isXAxisBoundsManual()
        Returns:
        whether the x axis bounds are manual.
        See Also:
        setMinX(double), setMaxX(double)

      • isYAxisBoundsManual

        public boolean isYAxisBoundsManual()
        Returns:
        whether the y axis bound are manual

      • onTouchEvent

        public boolean onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent event)
        will be called on a touch event. needed to use scaling and scrolling
        Parameters:
        event -
        Returns:
        true if it was consumed

      • releaseEdgeEffects

        private void releaseEdgeEffects()
        release the glowing effects

      • scrollToEnd

        public void scrollToEnd()
        forces the viewport to scroll to the end of the range by keeping the current viewport size. Important: Only takes effect if x axis bounds are manual.
        See Also:
        setXAxisBoundsManual(boolean)

      • setBackgroundColor

        public void setBackgroundColor(int mBackgroundColor)
        Parameters:
        mBackgroundColor - background of the viewport area use transparent to have no background

      • setBorderColor

        public void setBorderColor(java.lang.Integer borderColor)
        the border color used. will be ignored when a custom paint is set.
        Parameters:
        borderColor - null to reset

      • setBorderPaint

        public void setBorderPaint(android.graphics.Paint borderPaint)
        custom paint to use for the border. border color will be ignored
        Parameters:
        borderPaint -
        See Also:
        setDrawBorder(boolean)

      • setDrawBorder

        public void setDrawBorder(boolean drawBorder)
        optional draw a border between the labels and the viewport
        Parameters:
        drawBorder - true to draw the border

      • setMaxX

        public void setMaxX(double x)
        set the maximal x value for the current viewport. Make sure to set the x bounds to manual via setXAxisBoundsManual(boolean)
        Parameters:
        x - max / highest value

      • setMaxXAxisSize

        public void setMaxXAxisSize(double mMaxXAxisViewportSize)
        Set the max viewport size (horizontal) This can prevent the user from zooming out too much. E.g. with a 24 hours graph, it could force the user to only be able to see 2 hours of data at a time. Default value is 0 (disabled)
        Parameters:
        mMaxXAxisViewportSize - maximum size of viewport

      • setMaxY

        public void setMaxY(double y)
        set the maximal y value for the current viewport. Make sure to set the y bounds to manual via setYAxisBoundsManual(boolean)
        Parameters:
        y - max / highest value

      • setMaxYAxisSize

        public void setMaxYAxisSize(double mMaxYAxisViewportSize)
        Set the max viewport size (vertical) This can prevent the user from zooming out too much. E.g. with a 24 hours graph, it could force the user to only be able to see 2 hours of data at a time. Default value is 0 (disabled)
        Parameters:
        mMaxYAxisViewportSize - maximum size of viewport

      • setMinimalViewport

        public void setMinimalViewport(double minX,
                               double maxX,
                               double minY,
                               double maxY)
        minimal viewport used for scaling and scrolling. this is used if the data that is available is less then the viewport that we want to be able to display. if Double.NaN is used, then this value is ignored
        Parameters:
        minX -
        maxX -
        minY -
        maxY -

      • setMinX

        public void setMinX(double x)
        set the minimal x value for the current viewport. Make sure to set the x bounds to manual via setXAxisBoundsManual(boolean)
        Parameters:
        x - min / lowest value

      • setMinY

        public void setMinY(double y)
        set the minimal y value for the current viewport. Make sure to set the y bounds to manual via setYAxisBoundsManual(boolean)
        Parameters:
        y - min / lowest value

      • setOnXAxisBoundsChangedListener

        public void setOnXAxisBoundsChangedListener(Viewport.OnXAxisBoundsChangedListener l)
        set a listener to notify when x bounds changed after scaling or scrolling. This can be used to load more detailed data.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener to use

      • setScalable

        public void setScalable(boolean mIsScalable)
        active the scaling/zooming feature notice: sets the x axis bounds to manual
        Parameters:
        mIsScalable - whether the viewport is scalable

      • setScalableY

        public void setScalableY(boolean scalableY)
        activate or deactivate the vertical zooming/scaling functionallity. This will automatically activate the vertical scrolling and the horizontal scaling/scrolling feature.
        Parameters:
        scalableY - true to activate

      • setScrollable

        public void setScrollable(boolean mIsScrollable)
        Parameters:
        mIsScrollable - whether is viewport is scrollable

      • setScrollableY

        public void setScrollableY(boolean scrollableY)
        activate/deactivate the vertical scrolling
        Parameters:
        scrollableY - true to activate

      • setXAxisBoundsManual

        public void setXAxisBoundsManual(boolean mXAxisBoundsManual)
        Parameters:
        mXAxisBoundsManual - whether the x axis bounds are manual.
        See Also:
        setMinX(double), setMaxX(double)

      • setXAxisBoundsStatus

        public void setXAxisBoundsStatus(Viewport.AxisBoundsStatus s)
        change the state of the x axis. normally you do not call this method. If you want to set manual axis use setXAxisBoundsManual(boolean) and setYAxisBoundsManual(boolean)
        Parameters:
        s - state

      • setYAxisBoundsManual

        public void setYAxisBoundsManual(boolean mYAxisBoundsManual)
        Parameters:
        mYAxisBoundsManual - whether the y axis bounds are manual
        See Also:
        setMaxY(double), setMinY(double)

      • setYAxisBoundsStatus

        public void setYAxisBoundsStatus(Viewport.AxisBoundsStatus s)
        change the state of the y axis. normally you do not call this method. If you want to set manual axis use setXAxisBoundsManual(boolean) and setYAxisBoundsManual(boolean)
        Parameters:
        s - state
